meanings.definition: To crush or grind with a noisy, crunching sound.
meanings.sent1: I heard the leaves craunch under my feet as I walked through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The old machine craunched the rocks into tiny pieces.
meanings.sent3: The kids laughed as they tried to craunch the potato chips loudly.
meanings.sent4: The gears in the clock seemed to craunch together in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent5: The giant's footsteps craunched the pebbles beneath them.

meanings.sent1: The craunch of the gears echoed through the factory.
meanings.sent2: The old door made a loud craunch every time it opened.
meanings.sent3: The craunch of the car engine made everyone turn their heads.
meanings.sent4: The craunch of the metal against metal was deafening in the silence.
meanings.sent5: The craunch of the gears was a constant background noise in the workshop.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, crunching sound.
meanings.sent1: The snow craunched under my boots as I walked through the icy path.
meanings.sent2: The dry leaves craunched as the wind blew through the trees.
meanings.sent3: The toast craunched loudly as it popped out of the toaster.
meanings.sent4: The waves craunched against the rocks, creating a soothing rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The hiker's footsteps craunched on the gravel trail in the quiet forest.
